description.zh-cn: 清朝在第一次鸦片战争战败后与英国签订的条约，是中国近代史上第一个不平等条约。条约内容包括割让香港岛、开放五个通商口岸及赔款等。
description.en: A treaty signed between the Qing dynasty and the United Kingdom after the Qing's defeat in the First Opium War. It was the first of the unequal treaties in modern Chinese history. Its terms included the cession of Hong Kong Island, the opening of five treaty ports, and reparations.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪中期英国对中国发动的一场侵略战争，战争以中国失败并赔款割地告终，签订了《南京条约》。
description.en: An aggressive war launched by the United Kingdom against China in the mid-19th century, which ended with China's defeat, leading to reparations, territorial cessions, and the signing of the Treaty of Nanking.

description.zh-cn: 中国的最后一个帝制王朝。在第一次鸦片战争中战败，与英国签订了《南京条约》。
description.en: The last imperial dynasty of China. It was defeated in the First Opium War and signed the Treaty of Nanking with the United Kingdom.

zh-cn: 大不列颠及爱尔兰联合王国
en: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland

description.zh-cn: 19世纪的全球性帝国，在第一次鸦片战争中战胜清朝，并签订了《南京条约》。
description.en: A global empire in the 19th century that defeated the Qing dynasty in the First Opium War and signed the Treaty of Nanking.

description.zh-cn: 清朝宗室、大臣，作为钦差大臣代表清政府谈判并签署了《南京条约》。
description.en: A member of the Qing imperial clan and a minister who, as Imperial Commissioner, represented the Qing government in negotiating and signing the Treaty of Nanking.

description.zh-cn: 清朝大臣，时任乍浦副都统，作为清政府代表之一签署了《南京条约》。
description.en: A Qing dynasty official, then Deputy Lieutenant-General of Zhapu, who was one of the representatives of the Qing government to sign the Treaty of Nanking.

description.zh-cn: 英国陆军少将，作为英方特命全权公使签署了《南京条约》，并成为首任香港总督。
description.en: A major general in the British Army who, as the British Plenipotentiary, signed the Treaty of Nanking and became the first Governor of Hong Kong.

description.zh-cn: 清朝第八位皇帝。他在位期间爆发了第一次鸦片战争，并最终批准了《南京条约》。
description.en: The eighth emperor of the Qing dynasty. The First Opium War broke out during his reign, and he ultimately approved the Treaty of Nanking.

description.zh-cn: 大不列颠及爱尔兰联合王国女王和印度女皇。她批准了《南京条约》。
description.en: Queen of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland and Empress of India. She approved the Treaty of Nanking.

description.zh-cn: 根据《南京条约》，清政府于1842年将其割让给英国。
description.en: Ceded to the United Kingdom by the Qing government in 1842 under the Treaty of Nanking.

description.zh-cn: 《南京条约》规定的条款之一，要求清朝向英国商人开放广州、福州、厦门、宁波、上海五个港口进行贸易。
description.en: One of the terms of the Treaty of Nanking, which required the Qing dynasty to open the five ports of Guangzhou, Fuzhou, Xiamen, Ningbo, and Shanghai to British merchants for trade.

description.zh-cn: 清朝钦差大臣，因在广州实行严厉的禁烟政策，其行动成为第一次鸦片战争的导火索。
description.en: An Imperial Commissioner of the Qing dynasty whose strict anti-opium policies in Guangzhou became the catalyst for the First Opium War.

nodes.id: 第四代阿伯丁伯爵乔治·汉密尔顿-戈登

zh-cn: 第四代阿伯丁伯爵乔治·汉密尔顿-戈登

description.zh-cn: 英国外交大臣，曾向璞鼎查发出撤回割地要求的训令，但未被遵从。
description.en: British Foreign Secretary who issued instructions to Henry Pottinger to withdraw the demand for territorial cession, but was not obeyed.

description.zh-cn: 指清朝在19世纪通过一系列条约将香港（包括香港岛、九龙和新界）割让或租借予英国的历史事件。《南京条约》是这一系列事件的开端。
description.en: Refers to the historical event in the 19th century where the Qing dynasty ceded or leased Hong Kong (including Hong Kong Island, Kowloon, and the New Territories) to the United Kingdom through a series of treaties. The Treaty of Nanking marked the beginning of this process.

zh-cn: 五口通商附粘善后条款

description.zh-cn: 《南京条约》的补充条约，进一步规定了英国在中国的领事裁判权、片面最惠国待遇等特权。
description.en: A supplementary treaty to the Treaty of Nanking, which further stipulated British privileges in China, such as extraterritoriality and most-favoured-nation status.

description.zh-cn: 一项外交特权，指一国公民在另一国境内不受当地法律管辖。英国通过《南京条约》的补充条约在中国获得了此项权利。
description.en: A diplomatic privilege where citizens of one country are exempt from the jurisdiction of local laws in another country. Britain obtained this right in China through the supplementary treaties to the Treaty of Nanking.

description.zh-cn: 英法联军对中国发动的侵略战争。其起因部分源于《南京条约》执行过程中的争端。
description.en: An aggressive war launched by an Anglo-French expeditionary force against China. Its causes were partly rooted in disputes arising from the implementation of the Treaty of Nanking.

description.zh-cn: 指中华民国在中国大陆的统治时期。该时期的国民政府于1943年与英国签订新约，废除了《南京条约》中的部分不平等条款。
description.en: Refers to the period when the Republic of China governed mainland China. The Nationalist Government of this period signed a new treaty with the UK in 1943, abolishing some of the unequal clauses in the Treaty of Nanking.

zh-cn: 中英关于取消英国在华治外法权及其有关条约与换文

description.zh-cn: 1943年中华民国与英国签订的条约，旨在废除英国在华的治外法权及其他相关特权。
description.en: A treaty signed in 1943 between the Republic of China and the United Kingdom, aimed at abolishing British extraterritorial rights and other related privileges in China.

description.zh-cn: 根据《南京条约》开放的五个通商口岸之一，此后迅速发展成为中国最大的贸易港口。
description.en: One of the five treaty ports opened under the Treaty of Nanking, which subsequently developed rapidly into China's largest trading port.

description.zh-cn: 清朝官员，时任两江总督。在英军兵临江宁城下时乞和，并参与了《南京条约》签订前的部分活动。
description.en: A Qing dynasty official, serving as the Viceroy of Liangjiang. He pleaded for peace when British forces approached Jiangning and was involved in some activities leading up to the signing of the Treaty of Nanking.

description.zh-cn: 英国皇家海军的风帆战舰，在第一次鸦片战争中作为英军旗舰。《南京条约》在此舰上签订。
description.en: A sailing ship of the line of the British Royal Navy that served as the flagship during the First Opium War. The Treaty of Nanking was signed aboard this vessel.

description.zh-cn: 清朝的行政区划，今南京市。《南京条约》在此地的江面上签订，因而得名。
description.en: An administrative division of the Qing dynasty, modern-day Nanjing. The Treaty of Nanking was signed on the river here, hence its name.

description.zh-cn: 清朝在第一次鸦片战争中战败，国力受损，被迫签订不平等条约。
description.en: The Qing dynasty was defeated in the First Opium War, suffering a loss of national strength and being forced to sign an unequal treaty.

description.zh-cn: 第一次鸦片战争以清朝失败告终，直接导致了《南京条约》的签订。
description.en: The First Opium War ended in the defeat of the Qing dynasty, directly leading to the signing of the Treaty of Nanking.

description.zh-cn: 林则徐在广州的禁烟行动引发了与英国的冲突，成为第一次鸦片战争的导火索。
description.en: Lin Zexu's anti-opium campaign in Guangzhou triggered conflict with the United Kingdom, becoming the catalyst for the First Opium War.

description.zh-cn: 作为清朝钦差大臣，代表清政府签署了《南京条约》。
description.en: As the Imperial Commissioner of the Qing dynasty, he signed the Treaty of Nanking on behalf of the Qing government.

description.zh-cn: 作为清朝乍浦副都统，代表清政府签署了《南京条约》。
description.en: As the Deputy Lieutenant-General of Zhapu of the Qing dynasty, he signed the Treaty of Nanking on behalf of the Qing government.

description.zh-cn: 作为英国全权代表，签署了《南京条约》。
description.en: As the British Plenipotentiary, he signed the Treaty of Nanking.

description.zh-cn: 作为清朝皇帝，批准了《南京条约》使其生效。
description.en: As the Emperor of the Qing dynasty, he approved the Treaty of Nanking, putting it into effect.

description.zh-cn: 作为英国君主，批准了《南京条约》使其生效。
description.en: As the British Monarch, she approved the Treaty of Nanking, putting it into effect.

description.zh-cn: 《南京条约》第三条明确规定，清政府将香港岛永久割让予英国。
description.en: Article 3 of the Treaty of Nanking explicitly stipulated that the Qing government would cede the island of Hong Kong to Great Britain in perpetuity.

description.zh-cn: 《南京条约》第二条规定，清政府需向英国开放广州、福州、厦门、宁波、上海五处港口进行贸易。
description.en: Article 2 of the Treaty of Nanking stipulated that the Qing government must open the five ports of Guangzhou, Fuzhou, Xiamen, Ningbo, and Shanghai to Great Britain for trade.

description.zh-cn: 《虎门条约》是作为《南京条约》的补充和善后条款而签订的。
description.en: The Treaty of the Bogue was signed as a supplement and follow-up to the Treaty of Nanking.

description.zh-cn: 因《南京条约》执行过程中的翻译分歧和拒外情绪等争端，成为引发第二次鸦片战争的远因之一。
description.en: Disputes arising from the implementation of the Treaty of Nanking, such as translation discrepancies and anti-foreign sentiment, became one of the long-term causes of the Second Opium War.

description.zh-cn: 璞鼎查违背了英国外交大臣阿伯丁伯爵撤回割地要求的训令，在谈判中坚持并最终促成了香港的割让。
description.en: Henry Pottinger defied the instructions of British Foreign Secretary Lord Aberdeen to withdraw the demand for territorial cession, insisting on and ultimately securing the cession of Hong Kong during negotiations.

relationships.source: 第四代阿伯丁伯爵乔治·汉密尔顿-戈登

description.zh-cn: 作为英国外交大臣，曾于1841年向璞鼎查发出新训令，撤回割地要求，但此举未能阻止香港最终被割让。
description.en: As British Foreign Secretary, he issued new instructions to Henry Pottinger in 1841 to withdraw the demand for territorial cession, but this action failed to prevent the eventual cession of Hong Kong.

description.zh-cn: 耆英是道光帝派遣的钦差大臣，负责与英方谈判。
description.en: Keying was the Imperial Commissioner dispatched by the Daoguang Emperor to negotiate with the British.

description.zh-cn: 1943年签订的《中英平等新约》废除了英国在中国享有的领事裁判权（治外法权）。
description.en: The Sino-British New Equal Treaty signed in 1943 abolished the extraterritorial rights enjoyed by the United Kingdom in China.

description.zh-cn: 根据《南京条约》，上海成为五个通商口岸之一，此后迅速崛起为中国最大的贸易港口。
description.en: Under the Treaty of Nanking, Shanghai became one of the five treaty ports, and subsequently rose rapidly to become China's largest trading port.

description.zh-cn: 耆英与璞鼎查在江宁就《南京条约》的内容进行了谈判。
description.en: Keying and Henry Pottinger negotiated the terms of the Treaty of Nanking in Jiangning.

description.zh-cn: 时任两江总督牛鉴曾应璞鼎查之邀登上英舰，并在英军兵临城下时向其乞和。
description.en: Niu Jian, then Viceroy of Liangjiang, accepted Pottinger's invitation to board a British warship and pleaded for peace when British forces were at the city's gates.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国国民政府于1943年与英国政府签订了《中英平等新约》。
description.en: The Nationalist Government of the Republic of China signed the Sino-British New Equal Treaty with the British government in 1943.
